snippet: Mild, silly and inoffensive words are part of the subversive lexicon being used by Chinese bloggers to ridicule the government, poke fun at Communist Party leaders and circumvent the heavily censored Internet in China.
abstract: Mild, silly and inoffensive words are part of the subversive lexicon being used by Chinese bloggers to ridicule the government, poke fun at Communist Party leaders and circumvent the heavily censored Internet in China.

headline.main: Watch Your Language! (In China, They Really Do)
